sect1.title: Usage
sect1.para: Computes the scalar dot product of its two arguments. The general syntax for its use is y = dot(x,z) where x and z are numerical vectors of the same length. If x and z are multi-dimensional arrays of the same size, then the dot product is taken along the first non-singleton dimension. You can also specify the dimension to take the dot product along using the alternate form y = dot(x,z,dim) where dim specifies the dimension to take the dot product along.
